newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares soar on to 8th closing high in a row.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares soar on to 8th closing high in a row.

text.p: Danish share prices closed at another record closing level on Wednesday for the eighth successive trading day with dealers expecting imminent consolidation before further gains.
"Danish shares have been outdoing foreign markets but a period of retrenchment is needed and expected before we can expect to see gains resuming," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 0.24 point up at 126.49 in overall bourse turnover of 1.085 billion crowns. The KFX December future remained untraded at 125.75.
Banks were very much in focus, with BG Bank rising a solid 15 crowns to close at 243, its new 3.4 million crown equity issue oversubscribed.
Unibank put on three crowns to finish at 287, while rival Den Danske Bank shed five crowns to end at 429.
SAS Denmark attracted a lot of attention too, closing half a crown higher at 70.50 in 420,000 share turnover.
